job.title: Sr Manager, UX Design
job.description: Making an Impact: Gopuff is seeking an experienced design manager to oversee our product design, strategy, craft, and implementation for our consumers. This design leader is part of the Global Product Design and Research leadership team. They will create and motivate a team of industry and domain experts that own the product design life cycle, from product inception to delivery, with the goal of developing market-leading products. The scope is both UX and visual design intensive and includes tools and experiences for; the Gopuff app and website, growth, partner integrations, merchandising systems, ad systems and Gopuff’s loyalty program, Fam. This design leader must be collaborative and work closely across functions to drive differentiated products in a space that is ripe for innovation. It is critical that the leader be a strategic but pragmatic executor who can drive delivery and execution while also moving towards an inspired product vision. Working as a Team: The Global Product Design and Research team owns the end-to-end experience for all our customers, from the college kids in Philly ordering late night snacks to the mom in St. Louis taking care of her babies' needs and from the Gopuff driver in Denver to the fulfillment center worker in London. We build the apps and tools that power all aspects of Gopuff’s global delivery service. We’re organized around our three primary customers; consumers, delivery partners, and field ops professionals. We’re a diverse distributed team of creators, questioners, dreamers, and builders who dive deep into our customers needs and deliver innovative solutions for this new category of immediate everyday needs. A Day in the Life: Gopuff is the go-to solution for customers’ immediate everyday needs, from convenience items and home products to over-the-counter medications, and food and drinks. As the fastest-growing, most affordable delivery service in the market, Gopuff is open 24/7 in most areas and late night everywhere else, to bring customers what they need, when they need it most. We’re on a mission to shape the future of commerce by offering a unique combination of speed, selection, and a superior customer experience. #LI-Remote

You excel in a fast-moving environment and have the ability to collaborate across teams of varying disciplines, while also driving the rapid decision-making necessary to move and iterate quickly. Working as a Team: As a technology leader, you'll leverage your experience to both motivate and mentor your technical team through high-profile projects from design to delivery. Our leaders are accessible and humble, fostering a collaborative environment guided by a singular purpose, to build Gopuff into a generational company dedicated to delivering for the customer. We provide the modern-day solution to meet customer's immediate everyday needs with products ranging from snacks and ice cream to household goods and beer, at the click of a button. As the Director of Engineering Operations, you'll be responsible for the quality, stability, and scalability of Gopuff's technology ecosystem. #LI-Remote

Directly reporting to a Site Leader, OAs play an essential role at Gopuff that requires drive, perseverance, positivity, and enthusiasm for the challenge. You will accomplish a variety of operations responsibilities including picking, packing, receiving product, and working with our partner drivers. This is a temporary position with the opportunity to be converted to permanent employment based on tenure and performance. Customers turn to Gopuff to provide their everyday essentials—day and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks. Responsibilities: -Pick and pack items for dispatch to customers -Receive product from vendors, ensure physical count matches purchase order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies -Manage inventory and re-shelving of canceled orders -Clean and organize sales floor -Manage waste and spoilage through strict compliance with FIFO practice -Contact customer for substituted or out-of-stock items -Handle, scan and move product in a safe and well-organized manner -Stand, push, pull, squat, bend, reach and walk during shifts -Use carts, pallet jacks, dollies and other equipment to move product -Lift up to 49 pounds -Handle products that may contain tobacco, nicotine, and/or alcohol -Work in freezer locations periodically throughout shifts -Capability to walk several flights of steps periodically throughout the day Qualifications: -High School Diploma or GED Equivalent -Experience working in a restaurant or retail environment (preferred, not required) -The ability to work a fluid schedule and be available during peak shifts (1st, 2nd, 3rd shifts) -General working knowledge of basic web-based software applications (e.g. Google G-Suite)

job.title: Software Engineer II - FinTech
job.description: Gopuff’s engineering team is building solutions to dramatically change the way people purchase their daily goods. We provide the modern-day solution to meet customer’s immediate everyday needs with products ranging from snacks and ice cream to household goods and beer, at the click of a button. We are seeking a Software Engineer who is excited about creating innovative solutions to make life effortless for our customers! The kind of people we are looking for want to build optimized routing systems to efficiently deliver to our customers, create an end to end shopping experience that will delight our customers, devise warehouse management systems that enable us to always fulfill our customers’ needs, or design mobile and web applications that are joyful to use. The right candidate will be able to write code in a team environment where good work will improve our customers’ lives by giving them precious time back in their day. job.description: Gopuff is seeking an experienced product leader to own and drive our Delivery Partner Experience Product strategy and agenda. You will be responsible for all products that interact with our delivery partners including the Gopuff Driver App, Pay, Onboarding and Scheduling. You will lead an existing team of Product Managers, hire, develop and grow the team. Group Product Managers at Gopuff serve as portfolio managers for broad domains, and manage teams of driven product managers operating across multiple teams. This position reports to the Head of the Delivery Platform.

job.title: Strategic Partner Manager - Integrations
job.description: Overview Gopuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs, fulfilling customer orders of cleaning and home products to over-the-counter medications,food and drinks, and in some markets, alcohol - in just minutes. The company is at a pivotal point in its development and plans to hire a Strategic Partnerships Manager to manage its integration-based partnerships, designed to increase Gopuff owned inventory sales from partner-generated demand. This position serves as a key member of the BD team—serving as the partner’s primary point of contact, and advocating for the partner across the Gopuff organization to achieve mutual success. This position is responsible for deepening the partner relationship and continuously adding value by executing the Gopuff strategy. You will lead execution and go-to-market strategy for the company’s largest partnerships. You naturally gravitate toward using data and insights to change viewpoints on the client side. You are an analytical thinker who enjoys creative problem solving and understands how to scale, playbook, and iterate partnerships. The role is located remotely and reports directly to the Director of Strategic Partner Management

job.title: Site Leader Toulouse (m/f/x)
job.description: Gopuff a pour mission de faciliter le quotidien. Nous voulons être la solution de référence pour les besoins d’achat immédiats et quotidiens. Que vous achetiez des articles essentiels d’épicerie, pour la maison, pour bébé ou pour animaux, nous voulons que votre expérience soit étonnamment rapide, sans difficulté et inégalée. Gopuff dispose d’un réseau de petits entrepôts, appelés micro-fulfillment centers, dans des centaines de villes des États-Unis et nous sommes en train de nous développer en Europe. Nous stockons environ 3 000 produits dans chaque micro-fulfillment center, donc quand vous commandez, nous vous livrons directement vos produits. Nous ne facturons pas de prix exorbitants parce que nous ne sommes pas un service de messagerie, et parce que nous livrons directement les au lieu de les récupérer au magasin, nous livrons rapidement. Notre devise est : « Commandez en quelques secondes et soyez livré en quelques minutes » Nous sommes ravis d’entrer en Europe où nous offrirons la même expérience d’achat étonnamment rapide, sans problème et inégalée. Nous recherchons un Site Leader (H/F) pour le secteur de Toulouse qui veut relever un défi, qui croit en notre mission et qui veut faire croître l'entreprise et se développer personnellement. Nos magasins distribuent les commandes aux clients et nous recherchons un(e) chef de file énergique et orienté vers l'action, qui gérera une équipe terrain (gestion des stocks, préparation de commandes et livraison). job.title: Temporary Operations Associate, Lincoln, #100
job.description: Gopuff is looking for Operations Associates (OAs) to join the operations team. Directly reporting to a Site Leader, OAs play an essential role at Gopuff that requires drive, perseverance, positivity, and enthusiasm for the challenge. You will accomplish a variety of operations responsibilities including picking, packing, receiving product, and working with our partner drivers. This is a temporary position with the opportunity to be converted to permanent employment based on tenure and performance. Customers turn to Gopuff to provide their everyday essentials—day and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks. Responsibilities: -Pick and pack items for dispatch to customers -Receive product from vendors, ensure physical count matches purchase order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies -Manage inventory and re-shelving of canceled orders -Clean and organize sales floor -Manage waste and spoilage through strict compliance with FIFO practice -Contact customer for substituted or out-of-stock items -Handle, scan and move product in a safe and well-organized manner -Stand, push, pull, squat, bend, reach and walk during shifts -Use carts, pallet jacks, dollies and other equipment to move product -Lift up to 49 pounds -Handle products that may contain tobacco, nicotine, and/or alcohol -Work in freezer locations periodically throughout shifts -Capability to walk several flights of steps periodically throughout the day Qualifications: -High School Diploma or GED Equivalent -Experience working in a restaurant or retail environment (preferred, not required) -The ability to work a fluid schedule and be available during peak shifts (1st, 2nd, 3rd shifts) -General working knowledge of basic web-based software applications (e.g. Google G-Suite)

Directly reporting to a Site Leader, OAs play an essential role at Gopuff that requires drive, perseverance, positivity, and enthusiasm for the challenge. You will accomplish a variety of operations responsibilities including picking, packing, receiving product, and working with our partner drivers. This is a temporary position with the opportunity to be converted to permanent employment based on tenure and performance. Customers turn to Gopuff to provide their everyday essentials—day and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks. Responsibilities: -Pick and pack items for dispatch to customers -Receive product from vendors, ensure physical count matches purchase order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies -Manage inventory and re-shelving of canceled orders -Clean and organize sales floor -Manage waste and spoilage through strict compliance with FIFO practice -Contact customer for substituted or out-of-stock items -Handle, scan and move product in a safe and well-organized manner -Stand, push, pull, squat, bend, reach and walk during shifts -Use carts, pallet jacks, dollies and other equipment to move product -Lift up to 49 pounds -Handle products that may contain tobacco, nicotine, and/or alcohol -Work in freezer locations periodically throughout shifts -Capability to walk several flights of steps periodically throughout the day Qualifications: -High School Diploma or GED Equivalent -Experience working in a restaurant or retail environment (preferred, not required) -The ability to work a fluid schedule and be available during peak shifts (1st, 2nd, 3rd shifts) -General working knowledge of basic web-based software applications (e.g. Google G-Suite)

job.title: Product Manager (Principal or Senior) - Ranking & Recommendations
job.description: Gopuff is the go-to solution for customers’ immediate everyday needs, from convenience items and home products to over-the-counter medications, and food and drinks. As the fastest-growing, most affordable delivery service in the market, Gopuff is open 24/7 in most areas and late night everywhere else, to bring customers what they need, when they need it most. We’re on a mission to shape the future of commerce by offering a unique combination of speed, selection, and a superior customer experience. POSITION SUMMARY Every day millions of customers use Gopuff to find products for their daily needs. As a product lead for search relevance, ranking & recommendations, you will be responsible for surfacing relevant and personalized products to customers across their shopping journey. You will build core capabilities such as query understanding, knowledge graph, feature store etc. to improve search relevance and ranking. You will work with stakeholders across the company to optimize product ranking on search and category pages to deliver customer impact and business outcomes. Gopuff is growing fast and entering new product categories, which makes this a very exciting and high growth area to own and build a team around. In this highly visible role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams across Gopuff to identify key opportunities, create a compelling vision for the next generation ranking & recommendation systems, define success criteria and metrics, drive alignment, manage roadmap, and ship products. This position reports to the Director of Product. We have hubs in Philadelphia, San Francisco, Seattle, NYC, LA, Austin, Boston, and Chicago, and are location-agnostic for this role.

Report to the Kitchen Manager and work out of our capsule kitchens alongside our sites, you will create an enjoyable experience for our customers by providing prompt service, and quality food while maintaining a clean and comfortable kitchen environment. Customers turn to Gopuff to provide their everyday essentials—day and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks. You Will: -Prepare quality beverages and food menu items for all customers by observing all recipes and presentation standards -Ensure accuracy of all food and beverage packaged for delivery -Follow health, safety and sanitation guidelines for all products -Receive and put away order/invoice, and resolve discrepancies when they do not match expiration requirements -Maintain Kitchen Facility organization and standards to ensure resources can be accessed while managing waste and spoilage through mindful pouring and food preparation -Prepare, package and stage/handoff orders You Have: -High School diploma or GED equivalent -2+ years of food service and/or restaurant experience (preferred, not required) -Ability to lift and carry objects up to 50lbs -General working knowledge of basic web-based software applications (e.g. Google G-Suite) -Stand and walk for the duration of an assigned shift -Available to work flexible hours that may include mornings, evenings, weekends, nights and holidays We care about our team and want to make sure you know what to expect: -Handle, scan and move product in a safe and well-organized manner -Stand, push, pull, squat, bend, reach and walk during shifts -Use carts, pallet jacks, dollies and other equipment to move productLift up to 49 pounds -Handle products that may contain tobacco, nicotine, and/or alcohol -Work in freezer locations periodically throughout shifts

job.title: Shift Lead, Tallahassee, #480
job.description: Gopuff is seeking a Shift Lead for our operations teams. Reporting to the Site Leader, this role is a core part of the facility leadership team with the responsibility to ensure order accuracy and fast, efficient delivery to our customers. You will manage the performance of the Pack and Receive team and the development of our driver-partners. The success of the team will rely on your ability to drive and motivate the team with a focus on perfecting the customer experience for each order. Customers turn to Gopuff to deliver their everyday essentials—day and night, rain or shine. We're assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers and risk takers who are ready to help us reshape the world of retail faster than ever before. And it doesn't hurt if you like snacks. At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that's where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes. And now, we're assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world. Like what you're hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.
